abstract.text: A protocol that defines the interface to load media data asynchronously.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Loading media data takes an amount of time that depends on factors including the mediaâ€™s size, location, device capabilities, network conditions, and so on. To optimize performance,

defers loading its media data until you query its properties or perform an operation that requires it. This means that performing these actions from a synchronous context would block the calling thread for an unknown amount of time, which would result in a poor user experience, and may even cause your app to crash. For this reason, you must load media data asynchronously.
method to retrieve the values of media properties, or determine the loaded status of a property by calling the

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
A base class for asynchronous properties.
An object that models timed audiovisual media.
An object that models a track of media that an asset contains.
An asynchronous property that constrains its type and value.
A protocol that defines the interface to load media data asynchronously.
Loads a property asynchronously and returns the value.
Loads two properties asynchronously and returns the values.
Loads three properties asynchronously and returns the values.
Loads four properties asynchronously and returns the values.
Loads five properties asynchronously and returns the values.
Loads six properties asynchronously and returns the values.
Loads seven properties asynchronously and returns the values.
Loads eight properties asynchronously and returns the values.
Tells the asset to load the values of all of the specified keys that arenâ€™t already loaded.
Returns a value that indicates the loaded status of a property.
Returns a status that indicates whether a property value is immediately available without blocking the calling thread.
An object that combines and arranges media from multiple assets into a single composite asset that you can play or process.
A track in a composition that presents media of a uniform type.
An asset with a duration that the system can extend without modifying its existing media data.
An object that provides the track-level interface to inspect a fragmented assetâ€™s media tracks.
An object that represents a fragmented movie file.
An object that represents a track in a fragmented movie.
Values that indicate the loaded status of a property.
A metadata item for an audiovisual asset or one of its tracks.
An object that represents an audiovisual container that conforms to the QuickTime movie file format or a related format like MPEG-4.
A track in a movie that conforms to the QuickTime or ISO base media file format.
An object that you use to create a new composition from existing assets.
A mutable track in a composition that you use to insert, remove, and scale track segments without affecting their low-level representation.
A mutable metadata item for an audiovisual asset or for one of its tracks.
A mutable object that represents an audiovisual container that conforms to the QuickTime movie file format or a related format like MPEG-4.
A mutable track that conforms to the QuickTime or ISO base media file format.
An asynchronous property that constrains its type.
An asset that represents media at a local or remote URL.
Review unsupported symbols and their replacements.
Build responsive apps by using language-level concurrency features to efficiently load media data.
